result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:30 AM - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Susan L. Opper in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Bryant J Mcfadden in court for James Allen Rhodes.  
Defendant James Allen Rhodes not in court. 
Attorney Mcfadden indicates that his client is currently in custody in Milwaukee County.
Attorney Mcfadden requests another hearing date.  Court grants.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Hearing on July 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

CONDITIONS:
Defendant is not to operate a Motor Vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Case called at 8:39 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James Allen Rhodes in court.  
Court provides the defendant a copy of the Criminal Complaint,
Defendant acknowledges that he has received a copy of the Criminal Complaint and enter a not guilty plea.
State requests Cash Bail.
Court takes a recess at 8:44 a.m. to see if a Public Defender can speak to him.

Court recalls the cases at 9:19 a.m.
Attorney Steven Hughes indicates that the defendant does not qualify for a Public Defender.
Attorney Hughes indicates that he will appear as a friend of the Court for today.
Defendant will complete the paperwork for the the Court to appoint counsel.
Court will appoint counsel at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 8-1-2022.
State is requesting Cash Bail.
Attorney Hughes requests a Signature Bond.
Court will set a Signature Bond in the amount of $1,000.00
CONDITIONS:
Defendant is not to operate a Motor Vehicle without a valid driver's license.
  Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
